title: Business Live: Flutter shares soar after £6bn deal
text:
Getty Images Copyright: Getty Images

Deliveroo said sales surged 72% higher last year as the firm doubled the number of towns and cities it covers.

However, losses deepened to £232m in 2018, from £199m a year earlier as the company splashed out £18m on tech and £10m on free insurance for its riders.

Sales grew to £476m in the year to December 2018, up from £277m in 2017.

Will Shu, Deliveroo chief, said: "We are leading the field in innovation in food delivery, helping our restaurant partners to boost their sales and providing more well-paid work for riders."
